newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Manila Central Bank cuts overnight rates.
newsitem.headline: Manila Central Bank cuts overnight rates.

text.p: The Philippine Central Bank said on Thursday it cut its overnight rates by two percentage points each.
Its overnight borrowing rate is now down to 18 percent from 20 percent and overnight lending to 20 percent from 22 percent.
Traders said they had expected the Central Bank to lower its rates as the currency market calmed after recent speculation against the peso following the Thai baht's problems.
The move to cut rates by the Central Bank came a week after it was forced to raise rates by 8.75 percentage points to protect the peso.
"He (the Central Bank) has started to lower his rates gradually. That's what we had expected him to do," a dealer said.
Traders said the Central Bank would likely see how the peso would react to the new rate cut before bringing down rates further.
